lines.text: [Last lines]
No more theories then?
What have theories to do with love?
Dad, what would you do with a girl like that?
I'd grab her any way she'd have me.
Why Georgie, you look a little emaciated!

[Inebriated]
Well, I was just emaciated into the Elks Saturday night.
You look exactly like a peasant.
I am a peasant. There's no neurotic blood in me.
I'm bright and snappy in the morning.
And we're both a riot in our underwear!

[Lying on the couch]
I'm greedy of our happiness. I want to hold on to it as long as I can.
You know, Ann, sometimes this taking you home in the middle of the night, all the lying and pussyfooting... I...

[Playfully]
Don't say you don't like the pussyfooting! I love it!
[She lifts her legs up, throws her arms around him, and giggles]
Will someone please notice me and ask me some questions.
Go on, Don Juan, tell me about yourself.
Well, there have been women who wanted to park their heads on this manly bosom.
At how much an hour?

Nearly every girl I know, Mr. Ives, is either unhappily married or happily divorced, and I've simply come to the conclusion that marriage is disastrous to love. There's so much about it that's all wrong - the awful possession that people exert over each other, the intimacy, and the duties. I don't know... but love can't stand the strain, that's all.

[Drunkenly]
Who-whosever's coming with me better hurry. I got to get down to the Rotary Club and speak on better ventilation for birdcages.
What's new in the world of slander?
Innumerable things. Innumerable.
Anne, sometimes I don't understand you.
I understand you... very well.
I'm heartbroken.
A broken heart doesn't seem to go to that smile somehow.
Oh, if it isn't Anne. O-o, dirty Anne. Dick, you know Anne.

Oh, poor ole Georgie, he's all hot and bothered, isn't he. But, don't you worry, Georgie, you didn't put your foot in it. Because, Dick was weekending with a dazzling brunette. At least, I hope I dazzled. I did, didn't I, Dick?

You're not the kind of girl to get away with this sort of thing. Oh, I have no doubt there are many relationships of this kind. But, the successful ones, marry sooner or later. You can't lick the marriage institution.
Well, you don't give me very much choice, do you? Looks like I'll either have to pick you up or lay you down.
Better take me while you can get me.
Now, if that's all I were afraid of, I wouldn't be worried. Because, as a matter of fact, I'm not at all bad in my shimmy.
Anne Vincent, don't tell you're so old fashioned you wear a... under garments.
We used to be gay and young together. Now, we're only gay when we're around other people.
Monsieur, champagne! Quick! Tout de Suite!
Lafayette, he come.

[Playfully pouting, with a pretend French accent]
Oh, you are so naughty! Why you make so free with FiFi, heh?

[Picks up phone]
Vanderbilt One Seven Hundred. Thank you. Hello, Harvard Club. Richard Ives. Mrs. Ives. Hello, Dick! Hello, darling. How are you? Oh, nothing. Just lolling around, reading. What have you been doing? Oh, I'm sorry. I hope I didn't interrupt you? No, it isn't alright. You go right back to your game. No, I didn't want anything, really, Dick.
That was a stall and you know it. I came here for Dick's sake.
For Dick's sake!
